info.title: Legito API
info.description:
REST API versions 6 and 7 continue to be supported, with the exception of the ID parameter from objects in (a) the response to the endpoint GET `/document-version/data/{code}` and (b) the body of the request of endpoint POST `/document-version/data/{templateSuiteId}` and PUT `/document-version/data/{documentRecordcode}`.
The above-mentioned ID parameter was deprecated on January 15, 2024, and is longer be supported.
The other parameters (UUID and System Name) will remain unchanged and fully supported in the versions 6 and 7.


Legito features a RESTful interface that allows to edit most of your enterprise settings via API.

# Quickstart
The most common use-case is filling in data from your Customer Relation Management system (CRM), and creating a Word/PDF export of your document. To do this:
1. call POST `/document-version/data/{templateSuiteId}` to  create a new record for the document an fill in the initial data. To fill in the initial data, you will need to know the system names that are used in your document template.
  ![System name image](https://www.legito.com/images/api/system_name.png)

  example of data for an input element:
  ~~~
  [
    {
      "name": "first_party_name1",
      "value": "John Doe"
    }
  ]
  ~~~

2. Previous method returns metadata of created document record. Store document code from this metadata. It's a 40 character string eg.: `CaRDL6J7VOVqIrd7TazZyKd9pZWzxwiRylDtHdPc`
3. call GET `/document-version/download/{code}/` to download PDF/Word document

All of your calls need to be signed - please see the following section - Authentication.
For full description of different elements and supported values, also see our complete documentation

You can also see our [sample source code on Github](https://github.com/legito/api-wrapper).

# Authentication

For authentication Legito API uses a JSON Web Token (JWT) Bearer authentication scheme.

In the JWT bearer authentication flow, your application posts a JWT to the Legito service, asserting its credentials and providing the data of user wishes to impersonate (act on behalf of). Legito validates that the assertion is signed  (authenticated) and that your application has permission to act on behalf of the user.

## Prerequisites

First you need to generate an API key and a private key in Legito aplication `My account -> Settings -> Developers -> API`.

## Create a JWT token

To authenticate in the JWT bearer flow, you will need to create a [JWT](https://jwt.io/introduction/) token and include it in authorization header for each API request you send to Legito.

In its compact form, JSON Web Tokens consist of three parts separated by dots (.), which are:

- Header
- Payload
- Signature

### Header
The header, shown below, specifies the type of the token and algorithm used for signing it. For a Legito service integration, the header structure should always have a type of `JWT` and use `HS256` as its algorithm.

~~~
{
  "alg": "HS256",
  "typ": "JWT"
}
~~~

### Payload

The payload section contains data for the claims your application is making. Each Legito JWT must contain the following set of claims:

Claim | Description
------------ | -------------
iss | API key (generated in the prerequisites which idetify your Legito Workspace.
iat | Timestamp of when the JWT was issued, in Unix epoch time format.
exp | Timestamp of when the JWT assertion will expire, in Unix epoch time format. Default and maximal value is one hour from issed time.

~~~
{
  "iss": "94afa3c5-a1d5-4657-a8a6-7f968820792c",
  "iat": "1587459071",
  "exp": "1587462671"
}
~~~

### Signature

The signature section of the JWT is a digital signature that enables Legito to verify that the JWT was created by your application and was not modified since its was creation. The first two sections of the JWT are signed with your application's private key using `HS256` digital signature algorithm.

Secret to `HS256` algorithm is your generated `private key`

Example Signature
~~~
HMACSHA256(
  base64UrlEncode(header) +
  "." +
  base64UrlEncode(payload),
  $privateKey
);
~~~

## Creation of an authorization header

All of your API requests must include Authorization HTTP header with the Bearer authentication scheme whitch containing the JWT token

~~~
Authorization: Bearer <jwtToken>
~~~

parameters.description: Filter records by ID (more can be separated by pipe "|")

delete.summary: Removes external file from Document Record

parameters.description: Filter records by ID (more can be separated by pipe "|")

get.summary: Returns share lists for Document Record

post.summary: Creates a user share function for document record

delete.summary: Removes the user share function from Document record

post.summary: Creates a user group share for document record

delete.summary: Removes the user group share function from Document record

post.summary: Creates a External link for Document Record

delete.summary: Deactivates and removes the External Link

get.summary: Returns a list of Elements data from a document version’s data elements list

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: Type of list view or tree view

put.summary: Enter’s an Element’s data into a template and creates new document version

parameters.name: parentDocumentVersionCode
parameters.description: Code of Document Version that will be parent of new Document Version. Last Document Version od Document Record will be used as parent if not specified.

parameters.name: authorId
parameters.description: User ID of author that will be assigned to created Document Version. Default API user will be assigned if not specified.

parameters.name: languageId
parameters.description: Language ID that will be Document Version created in (if template is multilanguage). Language of parent Document Version will be used if not specified.

post.summary: Inserts Element’s data into template and creates new document version under new Document Record

parameters.name: favoriteSettingId
parameters.description: Favorite Setting ID - If Favorite Setting ID is not specified, document will be created with default Favorite Setting or with no Favorite Setting if default Favorite Setting is not exits in Template Suite.

parameters.name: authorId
parameters.description: User ID of author (and owner if not specified) that will be assigned to created Document Version and Document Record. Default API user will be assigned if not specified.

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: User ID of owner that will be assigned to created Document Version and Document Record. Default API user will be assigned if not specified

parameters.name: languageId
parameters.description: Language ID that will be Document Version created in (if template is multilanguage). Default language of Template suite will be user if not specified.

get.summary: Downloads document as a base64 encoded file

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Template ID - If template ID is not specified, all documents created from template suite from specified version will be downloaded.

parameters.name: advancedStyleId
parameters.description: Advanced style ID - If no advanced style is specified, default advanced style will be used.

parameters.name: disableConditions
parameters.description: If set Document will be exported with disabled conditions.

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: If set Comments will be exported in document.

parameters.name: helps
parameters.description: If set Helps will be exported in document.

parameters.name: forHandwriting
parameters.description: If set Inputs in the document you left blank are exported by default in form of [label]. If you tick this option, blank inputs will be generated as lines for convenient handwriting.

parameters.name: lowResolutionImages
parameters.description: If set Low resolution Images will be exported in document.

post.summary: Maps json data to new document version

get.summary: Returns a list of Template Suites
Returns a list of Template Tags

parameters.description: Filter users by ID (more can be separated by pipe "|")

parameters.description: Filter users by email (more can be separated by pipe "|")

post.summary: Creates a new user with default permissions

created.description: Creation date and time in ISO 8601

lastModified.description: Last modified date and time in ISO 8601

active.description: Active date and time in ISO 8601

externalDocument.description: True if document record is created as external document record

documentRecordTypeId.description: Document Record Type ID. Can be set only if externalDocument === true

detailLink.description: relative link to document detail in default country and language setting

priority.description: Priority of Document Record Type (for dropdowns in forms)

created.description: Creation date and time in ISO 8601

isRepeated.description: Flag if Template element is repeated in Template

repeatIdentifier.description: UUID path to identify repeat order. UUID is from Counter elements that holds value of repeat

monthByWord.description: Is month shown in word format

value.description: Value is property key from items
Value is property key from items

created.description: Created date and time in ISO 8601

date.description: Created date and time in ISO 8601

useMax.description: Maximal number of use of External Link (0 = infinite)

useActual.description: Actual number of use of External Link

permission.description: Permission to with be Document Record shared with

workflowStageId.description: Workflow Stage to with be Document Record be created

ownerId.description: Owner ID to with be Document Record be owned

uploadedDate.description: Uploaded date and time in ISO 8601

signBiosigned.description: File is signed by Legito Biosign

signAdobesigned.description: File is signed by Adobe Sign

data.description: File data in base64 format. This attrubute is present only in download action

externalLink.description: Add file exteral link to document

templateSuiteAll.description: Is Property applicable to all Template suites

templateSuites.description: Is Property applicable to Template suite IDs only

documentRecordTypeAll.description: Is Property applicable to all Document Record Types

documentRecordTypes.description: Is Property applicable to Document Record Type IDs only

showInList.description: Is Property shown in list view

showInFilter.description: Is Property shown filter in Document Managemet System

overwriteExtracted.description: Can be Property value manualy inserted if is extracted

overwriteManual.description: Can be Property value extracted if is manualy insrerted

share.description: True if Document Record will be automatically shared with selected User

sharePermission.description: Permission to with be Document Record will automatically shared with selected User

share.description: True if Document Record will be automatically shared with selected User Group

notification.description: true if date notifications is send to Document Record

notificationAdvance.description: number of secounds of notification advance

value.description: Financial value rounded to two digits

eventTypes.description: Apply Push Connection callbacks to the following Event types only

templateSuiteAll.description: Apply Push Connection to all Template suites

templateSuites.description: Apply Push Connection to Template suite IDs only

documentRecordTypeAll.description: Apply Push Connection to all Document Record Types

documentRecordTypes.description: Apply Push Connection to Document Record Type IDs only

attachFilesUploaded.description: Attach uploaded files to Push Request response

attachFilesGenerated.description: Attach generated files to Push Request response

fileTypes.description: Attach generated files only with file type

files.description: Attached files (is present only if some file type is selected in PushConnection)

uploaded.description: Attached uploaded files (is present only if is attachFilesUploaded selected in PushConnection)

generated.description: Attached uploaded files (is present only if is attachFilesGenerated selected in PushConnection)

recordOwnerAndSharing.description: Has Object active record owner and sharing

showWorkflow.description: Has Object have shown Workflow stage

created.description: Creation date and time in ISO 8601

lastModified.description: Last modified date and time in ISO 8601

active.description: Active date and time in ISO 8601

detailLink.description: relative link to record detail in default country and language setting

id.description: User ID (one of "id" or "email" must be set)

email.description: User email (one of "id" or "email" must be set)

perex.example: Some purchase agreement exciting perex text...

created.description: Expiration date and time in ISO 8601

sessionExpiration.description: Session expiration time in secounds (it is refreshed when page is reloaded). 0 for unlimited.

sessionDestroy.description: Session destroy expiration time in secounds from user logged in. 0 for unlimited.

customData.example: John Doe is my favorite person.

downloadPdfa.description: Can download document versions in .pdfa (it is possible only on Legito servers with PDFa support)

downloadWithView.description: Can download document with view permission

templateSuitesList.description: Have access to selected Template Suites only

templateSuitesCategoriesList.description: Have access to selected Categories only

templateSuitesCountriesList.description: Have access to selected Countries only

clausesLibraryList.description: Have access to selected Clauses only

clausesLibraryCategoriesAll.description: Permission to Clauaes from all Categories

clausesLibraryCategoriesList.description: Have access to Clauses from selected Categories only

clausesLibraryCountriesAll.description: Permission to Clauses form all Countries

clausesLibraryCountriesList.description: Have access to Clauses form selected Countries only

signLegitoBiosign.description: Can sign documents with Legito BioSign

objectsList.description: Have access to selected Objects only

created.description: Created date and time in ISO 8601

persistId.description: Workflow Element pesistant ID (it does not change when another workflow revision is created)

positionX.description: Workflow Element position in canvas X axis

positionY.description: Workflow Element position in canvas Y axis

type.description: Workflow Link special type (null if is normal link)

notify.description: Is notifications enabled in this stage

locked.description: Is document locked to editing in this stage

sign.description: Is document signing enabled in this stage

share.description: Is document sharing enabled in this stage

shareExternal.description: Is document sharing to guests enabled in this stage

download.description: Is document export (download) enabled  in this stage

email.description: Is send document by email enabled in this stage

trackChanges.description: Is track changes enabled in this stage

lockStage.description: Is Workflow Stage locked when approval is not finished

cancelOnChange.description: Is Workflow Stage canceled when Worflow Stage is changed

mandatory.description: Is User mandatory in Workflow Approval
Is User Group mandatory in Workflow Approval

disableShare.description: Is shring to User Group disabled
